column4: and it sometimes  works, sometimes doesn't so that shows that drivers are not the problem
also this is a desktop computer and also i tried Wicd and the same problem was the case
but, for some reason, if i reboot into windows then reboot into ubuntu it starts working again. Very strange
no, it only works if i boot into windows then reboot into ubuntu. I have tried both and only the first works
but it also does not work with wicd so how can it be drivers
either when i boot up it works with both wicd and default network manager, or it works with neither. SO it cant be a drivers problem
what should i try doing. ive tried almost everything but ive always had this same problem
but it works almost perfectly on winows 7 when it ius booted into
its a tplink and it has an atheros chipset
what should i do? im not expert. ive tried all sorts of crazy things to try and get it to work
Is ath9k loaded?
what do it do? sudo apt-get install ath9k?
i dont know if it is installed or loaded
or whatever
Eh, no, just check if it's loaded: lsmod | grep ath
im on ubuntu, and it just happens to be working now, as i said it sometimes does and sometimes does not
Sounds sort of random, I dunno. Try updating your system, may be a bug that's fixed in a new release
s/release/package versions/gi
ive updated, ive coped with the problem since about 11.10 when i started using ubuntu *A lot*

this is what came out of the terminal :ath9k                 131308  0  mac80211              539908  1 ath9k ath9k_common           14055  1 ath9k ath9k_hw              395218  2 ath9k,ath9k_common ath                    23827  3 ath9k,ath9k_common,ath9k_hw cfg80211              206566  3 ath9k,mac80211,ath
Hm, looks good to me... But then again it *is* working now so that's no surprise
